meanings.definition: Add new or modified parts or equipment to something that was not originally designed for it.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic will retrofit the old car with a new engine.
meanings.sent2: They decided to retrofit the house with solar panels to save energy.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to retrofit the recipe with unusual ingredients, but it didn't taste good.
meanings.sent4: She retrofitted her wardrobe with trendy accessories to update her style.
meanings.sent5: The students were asked to retrofit their science project with additional data for accuracy.

meanings.definition: Modify equipment or a building that is already in place to improve its performance or efficiency.
meanings.sent1: The company plans to retrofit the factory with new machinery for better production.
meanings.sent2: It is common for older buildings to be retrofitted with energy-efficient lighting.
meanings.sent3: The team tried to retrofit the broken robot with spare parts, but it kept malfunctioning.
meanings.sent4: He retrofitted his computer with upgraded components to enhance its speed.
meanings.sent5: The city council decided to retrofit the public library with modern technology for convenience.
